title: As Far from Land as Possible
content:
Given an N x N  containing only values 0 and 1, where 0 represents water and 1 represents land, find a water cell such that its distance to the nearest land cell is maximized and return the distance.
The distance used in this problem is the Manhattan distance: the distance between two cells  and  is .
If no land or water exists in the grid, return .
